newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway shares edge up with Wall Street.
newsitem.headline: Norway shares edge up with Wall Street.

text.p: Norwegian shares were up on Tuesday following the overnight rally in New York which drove Wall Street to a record close, but trade in Oslo was cautious, dealers said.
Oslo's Total share index rose 0.31 percent to 1,105.28 points in heavy turnover of 1.72 billion crowns.
But dealers noted more than 600 million crowns worth of shares were traded in branded-goods conglomerate Orkla as foreign investors took tax positions prior to the paying of dividend.
"Foreigers pay tax on dividend so they sell stock against an option to buy it back afterwards," one dealer said.
"Otherwise there is relatively low liquidity in the market. It seems Norwegian investors are on the sidelines while foreigners have been net sellers most of the year so far," he said.
"I think it will be pretty calm thorough the summer and we can only hope that more money will flow into the market in the autumn."
The Oslo Bourse is one of the smallest in Europe.
